verses.roman:
kṛṣṇa-yogānubhāvaṁ taṁ
niśamyendro 'ti-vismitaḥ
nistambho bhraṣṭa-saṅkalpaḥ
svān meghān sannyavārayat

synonyms: kṛṣṇa—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; yoga—of the mystic power; anubhāvam—the influence; tam—that; niśamya—seeing; indraḥ—Lord Indra; ati-vismitaḥ—most amazed; nistambhaḥ—whose false pride was brought down; bhraṣṭa—ruined; saṅkalpaḥ—whose determination; svān—his own; meghān—clouds; sannyavārayat—stopped.
translation: When Indra observed this exhibition of Lord Kṛṣṇa's mystic power, he became most astonished. Pulled down from his platform of false pride, and his intentions thwarted, he ordered his clouds to desist.
